body:
Thanks for the report - I think we don't consider yet that there are responses whose actual content length is not equal to `Content-Length`.

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7230#section-3.3

> Responses to the HEAD request method (Section 4.3.2 of [RFC7231]) never include a message body because the associated response header fields (e.g., Transfer-Encoding, Content-Length, etc.), **if present, indicate only what their values would have been if the request method had been GET**

We currently always set the content-length to the correct value at [http.py#L803-L806](https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/blob/aebad44d550d917489c802d0d51e1002f87b4e3b/libmproxy/protocol/http.py#L803-L806). I'm afraid we need to get rid of that, which should be done very carefully as quite a few features depend on that.
This should be fixed on master now, thanks!

On **0.15** I am still getting 0 as Content-Lenght on HEAD requests.

## Without Proxy:

curl -i -X HEAD http://vid.applovin.com/1428106347_x.mp4
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
X-Trans-Id: tx4577952af96b4ea88804c-00562d1eb2ord1
Last-Modified: Sat, 04 Apr 2015 00:12:29 GMT
ETag: 2940aaa3e549ad144d762bb184b3f557
Content-Length: 3223986
Accept-Ranges: bytes
X-Timestamp: 1428106348.10108
Content-Type: video/mp4
Cache-Control: public, max-age=604800
Expires: Thu, 17 Dec 2015 18:30:29 GMT
Date: Thu, 10 Dec 2015 18:30:29 GMT

## With Proxy:

X-Trans-Id: tx4577952af96b4ea88804c-00562d1eb2ord1
Last-Modified: Sat, 04 Apr 2015 00:12:29 GMT
ETag: 2940aaa3e549ad144d762bb184b3f557
content-length: 0
Accept-Ranges: bytes
X-Timestamp: 1428106348.10108
Content-Type: video/mp4
Cache-Control: public, max-age=604800
Expires: Thu, 17 Dec 2015 18:32:47 GMT
Date: Thu, 10 Dec 2015 18:32:47 GMT

issue.title: Setting streaming causes some responses to report empty Content-Length even when response size does not exceed the threshold

labels.name: kind/docs
labels.description: Documentation work needs to be done!

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body:
When streaming is enabled, multiple request that do not exceed the threshold are reported without content.

**WITH stream 50m**

```
GET https://impact.applifier.com/mobile/campaigns?platform=ios&gameId=5555&sdkVersion=1020&rawAdvertisingTrackingId=B18B33A9-C13A-4686-8B3B-A11B6CF227D4&advertisingTrackingId=c4c97e23f6d64dec7f42a553aefc889c&trackingEnabled=0&softwareVersion=9.0.1&deviceType=iPad5,3&connectionType=wifi&encrypted=false
   ← 200 application/json [content missing] 887ms
```

**WITHOUT stream**

```
GET https://impact.applifier.com/mobile/campaigns?platform=ios&gameId=5555&sdkVersion=1020&rawAdvertisingTrackingId=B18B33A9-C13A-4686-8B3B-A11B6CF227D4&advertisingTrackingId=c4c97e23f6d64dec7f42a553aefc889c&trackingEnabled=0&softwareVersion=9.0.1&deviceType=iPad5,3&connectionType=wifi&encrypted=false
   ← 200 application/json 6.88kB 1.52s
```

I was also trying to implement streaming on video files on my libmproxy implementation but seems to be failing for some hosts.

```
def handle_responseheaders(self, f):
    if f.request.method == 'GET':
        for _file_extension in STREAMING_FILE_LIST:
            if str(f.request.path).endswith(_file_extension):
                f.response.stream = True
```

body: Looks like you "currently always set the content-length to the correct value" again but now its at [message.py#L69-L70](https://github.com/mitmproxy/netlib/blob/d1e6b5366c97dd31c9b9606db2bb7a8520cfbd2c/netlib/http/message.py#L69-L70).  I have no idea what the right way to fix it is but for my testing, I don't need those two lines and so I removed them.
Fixed this one and added a regression test. Thanks!

issue.title: HEAD requests always have Content-Length: 0

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body: HEAD requests always have Content-Length: 0 where mitm should show the actual content length.

issue.title: Artifactory download failing with strconv.ParseInt

repository.name: jfrog-cli
repository.description: JFrog CLI is a client that provides a simple interface that automates access to the JFrog products.

issue.body:
I used the jfrog cli to upload to Artifactory 

```
jfrog rt u --build-name=bleep --build-number=10 --server-id=bloop random.bin generic-local/random.bin
```

and then try to download resulting in the error
```
JFROG_CLI_LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG jfrog rt dl generic-local/random.bin random-dl.bin
[Info] Searching items to download...
[Debug] Searching Artifactory using AQL query:
 items.find({"repo": "generic-local","$or": [{"$and": [{"path": {"$match": "."},"name": {"$match": "random.bin"}}]}]}).include("name","repo","path","actual_md5","actual_sha1","size","property","type")
[Debug] Artifactory response:  200 OK
[Info] [Thread 2] Downloading generic-local/random.bin
[Error] Artifactory strconv.ParseInt: parsing "": invalid syntax
```

I searched through the code looking for `ParseInt` and tried playing around with the `min-split` option because I thought it was failing in the `cli.go`. Turns out that isn't where it's failing but for some reason setting `--min-split=-1` will successfully download. Any other number for `min-split` results in the above failure

```
# this works!!!

JFROG_CLI_LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG jfrog rt dl --min-split=-1 generic-local/random.bin random-dl.bin
[Info] Searching items to download...
[Debug] Searching Artifactory using AQL query:
 items.find({"repo": "generic-local","$or": [{"$and": [{"path": {"$match": "."},"name": {"$match": "random.bin"}}]}]}).include("name","repo","path","actual_md5","actual_sha1","size","property","type")
[Debug] Artifactory response:  200 OK
[Info] [Thread 2] Downloading generic-local/random.bin
[Debug] [Thread 2]  Artifactory response: 200 OK
[Info] Downloaded 1 artifacts.
```

issue.title: Content-Length header set to 0 in HEAD requests during Export

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body:
### Problem Description

Similar to [this one](https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/issues/659). The `content-length` header value appears correctly in the web UI, but then it is incorrectly overwritten to `0` when executing a *raw* export.

#### Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Send a HEAD request that returns a non-zero `content-length` header value in the response (valid according to RFC)
> The Content-Length entity-header field indicates the size of the entity-body, in decimal number of OCTETs, sent to the recipient or, in the case of the HEAD method, the size of the entity-body that would have been sent had the request been a GET.

2. Observe the non-zero value in the web UI
3. Export the raw response and observe that the `content-length` header value in the response has been overwritten to `0`.


### System Information

```raw

```

### Checklist

- [x] This bug affects the [latest mitmproxy release](https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/releases).
